revised_title: A Review of J. Gregorio Scoto's Geometriae Pars Universalis and Related Works
tldr: The author provides an account of J. Gregorio Scoto's Geometriae Pars Universalis, a book that explores methods for measuring curved quantities and addresses objections to Scoto's previous work on the quadrature of the circle and hyperbola. The text also discusses related works and mathematical concepts, such as logarithms, the composition of ratios, and the resolution of equations.
